ArticleTitle.sentence: The role of jun and fos gene family members in 12-O-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate induced hemopoietic differentiation.

AbstractText.sentence: Terminal differentiation of the leukemic cell lines U-937 and HL-60 by 12-O-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate is accompanied by marked changes in gene expression.

event.clue: Terminal differentiation of the leukemic cell lines U-937 and HL-60 by 12-O-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate is accompanied by marked changes in gene expression.

AbstractText.sentence: In this study, we demonstrate that the expression of jun and fos gene family members is induced with variable kinetics during 12-O-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate induced differentiation, with c-jun expression best paralleling differentiation.

event.clue: In this study, we demonstrate that the expression of jun and fos gene family members is induced with variable kinetics during 12-O-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate induced differentiation, with c-jun expression best paralleling differentiation.

AbstractText.sentence: The generation of AP-1 complexes, as measured by DNA binding activity, closely parallels morphological differentiation.

AbstractText.sentence: Furthermore, the ability of these complexes to regulate gene expression is demonstrated by increased transcription from an AP-1 driven reporter construct and marked increases in the expression of endogenous AP-1 regulated genes.

AbstractText.sentence: Differentiation assays using water soluble phorbol esters reveal that differentiation becomes irreversible soon after AP-1 appears.

event.clue: Differentiation assays using water soluble phorbol esters reveal that differentiation becomes irreversible soon after AP-1 appears.

AbstractText.sentence: This tight correlation between c-jun expression, the generation of AP-1 activity, and differentiation suggests a critical role for this gene and transcriptional complex during this process.
